tool_input.command:
git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
fix(nextjs-supabase-ai-sdk-dev): Add ss fallback to killProcessOnPort

Fixes #253

The killProcessOnPort function now falls back to `ss -tlnp` when `lsof`
fails to find processes on a port. This resolves issues in WSL2 and
other Linux environments where lsof may not detect processes due to
permissions or environment limitations.

Changes:
- Try lsof first (preferred, more portable)
- Fallback to ss if lsof finds nothing
- Extract PIDs from ss output using grep and sed
- Maintain backward compatibility and same return contract

The ss command uses word boundary matching to prevent false matches
(e.g., port 3100 when searching for port 100).

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"
tool_input.description: Commit the killProcessOnPort fix
